org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcontroller.internal.Core

Class RobotComponent

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcontroller.internal.Core.RobotComponent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Drivetrain

    public abstract class RobotComponent
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Base class for robot components (drivetrain, shooter, etc.) The class implements Runnable to allow for parallel command execution instead of creating a new Runnable class for every parallel action we want to accomplish.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  RobotComponent.Command
      Interface for functional programming

    • Method Detail

      • init

        protected void init(RobotBase BASE)
        Initializes the hardware mapping object by creating a new instance
        Parameters:
        BASE - The robot base used to create the hardware mapper

      • run

        public final void run()
        Overwritten version of Runnable's run()- it is public out of necessity. DO NOT CALL THIS METHOD ON ITS OWN- YOU COULD GET INCORRECT COMMAND EXECUTION OR NULL POINTER EXCEPTION
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • runSequential

        public final void runSequential(RobotComponent.Command COMMAND)
        Runs the given command sequentially. The vast majority of TeleOp commands should be run sequentially to avoid unnecessary creation of threads.
        Parameters:
        COMMAND - Command to be run

      • runParallel

        public final void runParallel(RobotComponent.Command COMMAND)
        Executes a command on its own thread, hence parallel command execution. Does not need to be called in an op mode loop, unless the command is an expensive process that involves a loop.
        Parameters:
        COMMAND - Command to be run

      • getInput

        protected final void getInput(com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.Gamepad GAMEPAD1,
                              com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.Gamepad GAMEPAD2)
        Grabs input from a gamepad
        Parameters:
        GAMEPAD1 - Gamepad object for driver 1
        GAMEPAD2 - Gamepad object for driver 2
